DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Vitamin B12 Outcome Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a numerical quantity measured related to procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of body substance in a laboratory setting to get results for a cobalt-containing coordination compound produced by intestinal micro-organisms and found also in soil and water.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of body substance in a laboratory setting to get results for a cobalt-containing coordination compound produced by intestinal micro-organisms and found also in soil and water.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A cobalt-containing coordination compound produced by intestinal micro-organisms and found also in soil and water. Higher plants do not concentrate vitamin B 12 from the soil and so are a poor source of the substance as compared with animal tissues.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: An essential nutrient and natural water-soluble vitamin of the B-complex family that must combine with an intrinsic factor for absorption by the intestine, Vitamin B12 (cyanocobalamin) is necessary for hematopoiesis, neural metabolism, DNA and RNA production, and carbohydrate, fat, and protein metabolism. B12 improves iron functions in the metabolic cycle and assists folic acid in choline synthesis. B12 metabolism is interconnected with that of folic acid. Vitamin B12 deficiency causes pernicious anemia, megaloblastic anemia, and neurologic lesions.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCIC CRF:National Cancer Institute of Canada Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numerical quantity measured for vitamin B12.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: NCIC CRF:National Cancer Institute of Canada Case Report Form
